page.title: 16Changing times, Fraserburgh
page.content: Recollections of Elizabeth Downie, born l905 and Jane Craig, born l925:-. l905: Steam drifters went out to sea at midnight on Sunday. The curers were waiting at the market at the break of dawn to buy the catch brought in. The herrings were sold by the cran.Prices varied according to the size of the herring. The women were ready to gut and pack the barrels which were made by the coopers. The Russians were one 0f the best buyers. There was plenty of work for the women as they travelled with the boats. l925:The houses were old fashioned but clean.It was better then because you were more contented.There were only horses and carts.The clothes weren't fashionable and mostly dark colours.The shops were mostly small.The school was strict and hard.There were few jobs for girls. Diseases: Scarlet Fever & Diptheria.
